intro: Galium megacyttarion, commonly known as the giant bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Galium megacyttarion is often found in montane and subalpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects.
